Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: The "real India" has Muslims and Hindus in every village and every city! How do you propose to separate them?

Speaker: jinnah
Dialogue: Where there is a Muslim majority -- that will be Pakistan. The rest is your India.

Speaker: patel
Dialogue: Mohammed -- the Muslims are in a majority on two different sides of the country.

Speaker: jinnah
Dialogue: Let us worry about Pakistan -- you worry about India.

Speaker: mountbatten
Dialogue: Gentlemen, perhaps we should recommence.

Speaker: godse
Dialogue: Death to Jinnah! Death to Jinnah!

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Thank God, they've stopped.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: I'm your grand uncle but I can still walk either of you into the ground and I don't need to be pampered this way!

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Finish your quota of spinning.

Speaker: hindu youth
Dialogue: Bapu -- please. Don't do it!

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: And a Hindu, and a Christian and a Jew -- and so are all of you. When you wave those flags and shout you send fear into the hearts of your brothers.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: This is not the India I want. Stop it. For God's sake, stop it.

Speaker: jinnah
Dialogue: Now, please, if you've finished your prayers, could we begin with business.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: My dear Jinnah, you and I are brothers born of the same Mother India. If you have fears, I want to put them to rest.  -- to name your entire cabinet, to make the head of every government department a Muslim.

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: Bapu, for me, and the rest,  already there is rioting because Hindus fear you are going to give too much away.

Speaker: patel
Dialogue: If you did this, no one could control it. No one.

Speaker: jinnah
Dialogue: It is your choice. Do you want an independent India and an independent Pakistan? Or do you want civil war?

Speaker: kallenbach
Dialogue: Tomorrow. Tomorrow photograph him.

Speaker: kallenbach
Dialogue: It is violence, and the fear of violence, that have made today what it is... Give him the dignity of his grief.

Speaker: kallenbach
Dialogue: Gandhi will pray for them...

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: No. There just are not that many troops.

Speaker: military aide
Dialogue: What's he to do?

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: What he can!

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: He was right. It's insane -- anything would have been better.

Speaker: patel
Dialogue: Have you found him?

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: He's in Noakhali.

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: He's tramping from village to village -- no police, no troops -- trying to quell the madness single-handedly.  Maulana has gone to bring him back.

Speaker: nehru's voice
Dialogue: What you have done in Noakhali is a miracle, Bapu, a miracle, but millions are on the move -- millions. There is no way to stop it... and no one can count the dead.

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: In Calcutta it's like civil war. The Muslims rose and there was a bloodbath, and now the Hindus are taking revenge -- and if we can't stop it there'll be no hope for the Hindus left in Pakistan.

Speaker: patel
Dialogue: ...an eye for an eye making the whole world blind.

Speaker: azad
Dialogue: Aren't there any troops to spare?

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: Nothing -- nothing. The divisions in Bombay and Delhi can hardly keep the peace now. And each fresh bit of news creates another wave of  mad... ness.

Speaker: patel
Dialogue: Could we cut all news off? I know --

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: Bapu -- please. Where are you going.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: I don't want to hear more...

Speaker: patel
Dialogue: We need your help!

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: There is nothing I can give.

Speaker: azad
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Calcutta.

Speaker: police commissioner
Dialogue: Sir, please, I don't have the men to protect you -- not in a Muslim house. Not this quarter.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: I am staying with the friend of a friend.

Speaker: a youth
Dialogue: There he is!

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Because forgiveness is the gift of the brave.

Speaker: youth
Dialogue: To hell with you, Gandhi!!

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Go -- do as your mother and father would wish you to do.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: I have lived a lifetime. If I had shunned death -- or feared it -- I would not be here. Nor would you be concerned for me.  You have more important things to worry about.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Bapu... Allah be with you...

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: And with you.  Pray... I cannot help you -- pray... pray.

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: No! There will not be a Hindu Police and a Muslim Police. There is one police!

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: Why must I read news like this in the paper?

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: Tell Patel. Arrange a plane. We will go -- Friday.

Speaker: the aide
Dialogue: Four days?

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: Bapu...

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Sardar...  You have gained weight. You must join me in the fast.

Speaker: patel
Dialogue: If I fast I die. If you fast people go to all sorts of trouble to keep you alive.

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: Bapu, forgive me -- I've cheated. I could have come earlier. But your fast has helped. These last days people's minds have begun to turn to this bed -- and away from last night's atrocity. But now it is enough.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: All that has happened is that I've grown a little thinner.

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: Tomorrow five thousand Muslim students of all ages are marching here in Calcutta -- for peace.  And five thousand Hindu students are marching with them. It is all organized.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: I'm glad -- but it will not be enough.

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: Bapu, you are not so young anymore.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Don't worry for me -- death will be a deliverance.  I cannot watch the destruction of all I have lived for.

Speaker: mirabehn
Dialogue: Bapu...

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Each night before I sleep, I read a few words from the Gita and the Koran, and the Bible...  tonight I ask you to share these thoughts of God with me.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: I will begin with the Bible where the words of the Lord are, "Love thy neighbor as thyself"... and then our beloved Gita which says, "The world is a garment worn by God, thy neighbor is in truth thyself"... and finally the Holy Koran, "We shall remove all hatred from our hearts and recline on couches face to face, a band of brothers."

Speaker: mirabehn
Dialogue: "Lead Kindly Light, amidst the circling gloom..."

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: Come! Kill me first! Come! Where are you?! Kill me first!

Speaker: mirabehn
Dialogue: His pulse is very irregular -- the kidneys aren't functioning.

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: Bapu, I have brought Mr. Suhrawardy. It was he who called on the Muslims to rise; he is telling them now to go back to their homes, to lay down their arms.

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: Think what you can do by living -- that you cannot do by dying.

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: What do you want?

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: That the fighting will stop -- that you make me believe it will never start again.

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: ...Sometimes it is when you are quite without hope and in utter darkness that God comes to the rescue. Gandhiji is dying because of our madness. Put away your "revenge." What will be gained by more killing? Have the courage to do what you know is right. For God's sake, let us embrace like brothers...

Speaker: goonda leader
Dialogue: It is our promise. We stop. It is a promise.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Go -- try -- God by with you.

Speaker: nahari
Dialogue: Eat.

Speaker: nahari
Dialogue: Eat! I am going to hell -- but not with your death on my soul.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Only God decides who goes to hell...

Speaker: nahari
Dialogue: I smashed his head against a wall.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Why? Why?

Speaker: nahari
Dialogue: They killed my son -- my boy!

Speaker: nahari
Dialogue: The Muslims killed my son... they killed him.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: I know a way out of hell.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Find a child -- a child whose mother and father have been killed. A little boy -- about this high.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: ...and raise him -- as your own.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Only be sure... that he is a Muslim. And that you raise him as one.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Go -- go. God bless you...

Speaker: constable
Dialogue: Yes, sir, yes, sir,  "Wait."

Speaker: constable
Dialogue: Accident, "Christie crossroads," a lorry and a rickshaw. Yes, sir, I have it.

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: I wouldn't have believed it, Mr. Gupta.

Speaker: senior officer
Dialogue: Sergeant, it's a bloody miracle...

Speaker: mirabehn
Dialogue: Bapu, there's been no fighting -- anywhere. It has stopped -- the madness has stopped.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: It is foolish if it is just to save the life of an old man.

Speaker: mirabehn
Dialogue: No... no. In every temple and mosque they have pledged to die before they lift a hand against each other.

Speaker: patel
Dialogue: Everywhere.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Maulana, my friend, could I have some orange juice... Then you and I will take a piece of bread together...

Speaker: nehru
Dialogue: You see, Bapu, it is not difficult. I have fasted only a few hours and I accomplished what you could not do in as many days.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: That is how you eat muli.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: I'm not sure I want to be remembered that way.

Speaker: patel
Dialogue: No, he'll be remembered for tempting fate.

Speaker: abha
Dialogue: Mickey Mouse.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: I'm simply going to prove to Muslims there, and Hindus here, that the only devils in the world are those running around in our own hearts -- and that's where all our battles ought to be fought.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Not a very good one. That's why I have so much tolerance for the other scoundrels of the world.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Ask Panditji to -- to consider what we've discussed.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Enough.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: You're a temptress.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Nothing's more dangerous, especially for an old man.

Speaker: mirabehn
Dialogue: He thinks he's failed.

Speaker: mirabehn
Dialogue: I am blinded by my love of him, but I think when we most needed it, he offered the world a way out of madness. But he doesn't see it... and neither does the world.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Allah be with you.

Speaker: manu
Dialogue: Brother, Bapu is already late for prayers.

Speaker: gandhi
Dialogue: Oh, God... oh, God...

Speaker: gandhi's voice
Dialogue: ...There have been tyrants and murderers -- and for a time they can seem invincible. But in the end they always fall. Think of it -- always... When you are in doubt that that is God's way, the way the world is meant to be... think of that.
